resources.string: The National Historical Museum of Artillery traces its origins back to 1731 as a collection within the Arsenal . It became an official institution in 1842 and was granted \"national\" status in 1861.

Transferred to the Mastio in 1893, it was expanded in 1961. Today, it houses over 12,000 artifacts that illustrate the technological and historical evolution of artillery, from the Middle Ages to the 20th century.
The Amione Barracks on Corso Lecce host the accessible storage facility and serve as an operational space for research and conservation .
This extraordinary heritage, unique in Italy, reflects both technical ingenuity and military tradition, deeply rooted in the context of the Risorgimento and the development of technical education.

This location of the National Museum of Artillery is housed in the Mastio della Cittadella, the only surviving tower of Turin\'s 16th-century military citadel. Located at the corner of Corso Galileo Ferraris and Via Cernaia, it is a rare example of Renaissance military architecture.

The museum\'s permanent collection includeshistoric artillery pieces , firearms, and military models, illustrating the evolution of warfare technology. Its thick walls and vaulted ceilings immerse visitors in centuries of military history.

Following major restoration between 2008 and 2018, the Mastio reopened with exhibitions, educational activities, and guided tours, serving as both a historical monument and a cultural landmark in the heart of Turin.

A temporary exhibition exploring the technological evolution of artillery from the Middle Ages to the present day, with a focus on engineering and scientific innovation.

Featuring key historical artifacts and engaging displays, the exhibition reveals how advances in design, materials, and ballistics transformed artillery and influenced military strategy throughout history.
